Chapter 5, Part 3: The World System of the Flower Treasury, Part 3

In these ten ineffable buddha-realms of fragrant seas, there are ten ineffable buddha-realms of world systems, all relying on the adornment of lotuses adorned with maá¹‡i jewels manifesting the forms of all bodhisattvas, abiding without interruption at the borders of each adornment, each emitting jewel-colored light, each with light clouds covering above, each with its own adornments, each with different kalpas, each with buddhas appearing, each expounding the ocean of Dharma, each completely filled with sentient beings, each pervading the ten directions, each empowered by the spiritual power of all buddhas.
In each of these world systems, all worlds abide in various adornments, connecting with each other to form a network of worlds;
in the ocean of the world of adornments of the Dharma Realm, various distinctions are established everywhere.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, wanting to restate the meaning, spoke in verse with the power of the Buddha's spiritual penetrations, saying:
The ocean of the Flower Treasury world is equal to the Dharma realm, without distinction,
Its adornments are extremely pure, abiding in the sky.
In this ocean of worlds, the types of lands are inconceivable,
Each and every one is sovereign, each without confusion.
The ocean of the Flower Treasury world is well-arranged with types of lands,
With various shapes and different adornments, their characteristics not the same.
The transformed sounds of the buddhas are of various kinds,
Seen according to the power of one's karma, the types of lands are wonderfully adorned.
Mount Sumeru, nets of cities, water eddies, circular shapes,
Vastly open like blooming lotus flowers, each surrounding the others.
Mountain banners, pavilion shapes, revolving vajra shapes,
In this way, the inconceivable, vast various buddha lands
Are like the flames of pearls in the great ocean, with nets of light beyond conception.
In this way, all the various buddha lands are all situated in lotus flowers.
Each of the various buddha lands has nets of light beyond description.
Within the light, all the lands are manifested, pervading the oceans in the ten directions.
All the various buddha lands have adornments,
And all the lands enter within them, universally seen without end.
The various buddha lands are inconceivable, the worlds have no boundaries,
The various wondrous adornments are all due to the power of the great sage.
In all the various buddha lands, the worlds are inconceivable,
Some are forming, some are decaying, some have already been destroyed.
Just as in a forest, some leaves are born and some fall,
In this way, in the various buddha lands, the worlds have formation and decay.
Just as there are various fruits in a forest,
In the same way, various beings dwell in the various buddha-fields.
Just as different seeds produce different fruits,
Due to the differences in the power of karma, the buddha-fields of beings are not the same.
Just as the wish-fulfilling jewel, according to one's wishes, manifests various forms,
Because the minds of beings are pure, they see the pure buddha-fields.
Just as the great dragon kings produce clouds that cover the sky,
In the same way, by the power of the Buddha's vows, all lands are born.
Just as a magician or an incantation can manifest various things,
Due to the power of beings' karma, the buddha-fields are inconceivable.
Just as various images are created by the painter,
In the same way, all lands are created by the painter of the mind.
The bodies of beings are different, arising from the mind's discrimination,
are all due to karma.
Just as when seeing a leader, there are various differences in appearance,
according to the mental activities of beings, seeing various lands is also like this.
At the borders of all lands, lotus nets are spread everywhere,
with various appearances not the same, the adornments all pure.
In those lotus nets, the nets of lands are securely established,
with various adornments and various abodes of beings.
In some lands, there are dangers and unevenness,
due to the afflictions of beings, they are seen like this.
The various kinds of lands, with their impurities and purity,
arise according to the minds of beings, upheld by the power of the bodhisattvas.
In some lands, there are impurities and purity,
arising from the power of karma, transformed by the bodhisattvas.
Some lands emit light, made of pure jewels,
With various wondrous adornments, purified by the buddhas.
In each kind of land, the burning of eons is inconceivable,
Although what appears is ruined and evil, its place is always firm and solid.
Due to the power of beings' karma, many lands are produced,
Relying on the wind wheel and abiding in the water wheel.
The Dharma of the world is like this, with various different views,
But in reality there is no birth, and also no destruction.
In each thought, immeasurable lands are produced,
Seen as pure and immaculate through the Buddha's majestic spiritual power.
Some lands are made of mud, their substance is very hard and solid,
Dark and gloomy, without any light, inhabited by evildoers.
Some lands are made of vajra, mixed with great fear and terror,
Suffering is abundant while joy is scarce, the abode of those with little merit.
Some are made of iron, some of red copper,
Stone mountains are dangerous and frightening, filled with sinful and evil ones.
Within some realms there are hells, where sentient beings suffer without rescue,
Always in darkness, burned by the flames of the ocean.
Some are born as animals, with various ugly forms,
Due to their own evil karma, they constantly experience various sufferings.
Some see the realm of Yama, tormented by hunger and thirst,
Ascending a great fiery mountain, experiencing the most extreme suffering.
Some realms are composed of the seven treasures,
Various palaces and halls are attained through pure karma.
You should observe the world, within which are humans and gods,
The fruits of pure karma are accomplished, and they experience happiness according to the season.
In each pore, there are billions of lands, inconceivable,
Adorned with various characteristics, never crowded.
The karma of each sentient being, the worlds are of innumerable kinds,
In them, they take birth with attachment, experiencing suffering and joy differently.
Some lands are made of myriad treasures, always emitting boundless light,
Adorned with vajra and wondrous lotuses, pure and immaculate.
Some lands have light as their essence, abiding in the light-wheel,
Golden-colored, with the fragrance of sandalwood, illuminating everywhere with flaming clouds.
Some lands are formed from the moon's orb, with fragrant garments spread all around,
In each lotus flower, bodhisattvas are all filled to capacity.
Some lands are made of myriad treasures, with unstained colors and characteristics,
Like the net of Indra, the light always shines brightly.
Some lands have fragrance as their essence, or are made of vajra flowers,
The reflections of maá¹‡i jewels are observed to be extremely pure.
Some inconceivable lands are accomplished by revolving flowers,
With transformed buddhas filling them all, and bodhisattvas' universal radiance.
Some pure lands are all composed of flower trees,
With wonderful branches spreading out as the site, shaded by maá¹‡i jewel clouds.
Some lands are pure, their light illuminating, formed from vajra flowers,
Some have this as the Buddha's transformed sound, arrayed without bounds to form a net.
Some lands are like bodhisattvas' crowns of wondrous maá¹‡i jewels,
Some have the shape of seats, emerging from transformed light.
Some are sandalwood powder, some are the light from the brows,
Some are formed from the Buddha's light and sound, creating these wondrous lands.
Some see pure lands adorned with a single light,
Some see many adornments, all kinds of marvels.
Or using the wondrous objects of ten buddha-lands to create adornments,ğŸ”½Or using everything in a thousand lands to decorate,
Or using the objects of a billion lands to adorn a single land,
The various appearances are not the same, all appearing like reflections.
The objects of unspeakable lands adorn a single buddha-land,
Each emitting light, arising from the TathÄgata's vow power.
There are also some lands, purified by the power of vows,
In the midst of all the adornments, universally seeing the ocean of lands.
Those who cultivate Samantabhadra's vows obtain a pure land,
The adornments of the lands of the three times are all manifested within it.
Buddha's disciple, you should observe the majestic power of the buddha-land,
In the future, all lands will be seen like dreams.
The ocean of lands in the past of the worlds of the ten directions,
All manifest images in a single instant, like transformations.
All the buddhas of the three times, and their lands,
In a single realm, all are seen.
The spiritual powers of all buddhas, dust motes manifesting myriad lands,
Various, all clearly seen, like reflections, without reality.
Some have many lands, their shapes like great oceans,
Some like Mount Sumeru, worlds inconceivable.
Some lands well-established, their shapes like Indra's net,
Some like the shape of forests, buddhas filling them.
Some shaped like jeweled wheels, some like lotus flowers,
Eight corners with various adornments, various, all pure.
Some like the shape of seats, some with three corners,
Some like the kÄ«caka, city ramparts, and BrahmÄ's body.
Some are like the topknot of the Lord of Heaven, some are like a half-moon,
Some are like a maá¹‡i jewel mountain, some are shaped like the sun's disk.
Some world-systems are shaped like a swirling ocean of fragrance,
Some are formed into a circle of light, purified by the Buddha in the past.
Some have the shape of a wheel rim, some have the shape of an altar,
Some are like the Buddha's tuft of white hair, usnÄ«á¹£a, and elongated eyes.
Some are like the Buddha's hands, some are like a vajra scepter,
Some are shaped like a flame mountain, with bodhisattvas pervading everywhere.
Some have the shape of a lion, some have the shape of an ocean clam,
With immeasurable various forms and appearances, each with its own nature.
Within a single buddha-land, the shapes of lands are inexhaustible,
All due to the Buddha's vow power, protected and peacefully abiding.
Some lands abide for one eon, some abide for ten eons,
Up to a hundred thousand, the number of dust particles in a buddha-land.
In one eon, they see buddha-lands undergoing formation and destruction,
Or for immeasurable, countless eons, up to inconceivable eons.
Some buddha-lands have buddhas, some do not;
Some have only one buddha, some have innumerable buddhas.
If a buddha-land has no buddha, from other worlds,
Buddhas transform and come, manifesting various abilities.
Descending from the heavens, taking on human form, entering the womb and being born,
Subduing demons, attaining perfect enlightenment, turning the unsurpassed Dharma wheel.
In accordance with the inclinations of sentient beings, they manifest various appearances,
Turning the wonderful Dharma wheel, all in accord with their faculties and desires.
In each buddha-land, a single buddha appears in the world,
For millions of years, expounding the unsurpassed Dharma.
Sentient beings are not suitable vessels, and cannot see the buddhas,
If there are those who delight in the mind, they will see everywhere.
In each land, there are buddhas appearing in the world,
The buddhas in all lands are innumerable and inconceivable.
In each of these, the buddhas manifest immeasurable spiritual transformations,
Universally pervading the Dharma realm, taming the ocean of sentient beings.
There are lands without light, dark and fearful,
With painful sensations like swords and swords, those who see them suffer themselves.
There are also the lights of the devas, the lights of the palaces,
The lights of the sun and moon, the inconceivable net of lands.
There are lands with their own light, or trees emitting pure light,
Never having any suffering or distress, due to the power of the merit of sentient beings.
There are also the lights of the mountains, the lights of maá¹‡i jewels,
Or by the light of lamps, all by the power of sentient beings' karma.
Some have the Buddha's light, with bodhisattvas filling it,
Some have lotus flower light, with flames of color extremely magnificent.
Some lands are illuminated by flower light, some by the light of fragrant water,
Anointing incense, burning incense light, all due to the power of pure vows.
Some are illuminated by cloud light, some by the light of maá¹‡i shells,
The light of the Buddha's spiritual power can proclaim pleasing sounds.
Some are illuminated by the light of jewels, some by the light of vajra flames,
Pure sounds can reverberate far, wherever they reach there are no sufferings.
Some have the light of maá¹‡is, some the light of adornments,
Some have the light of the enlightenment site, illuminating the midst of the assembly.
The Buddha emits great light, with transformed Buddhas filling it,
That light universally illuminates and touches, pervading the Dharma realm everywhere.
There are realms that are extremely terrifying, with the great sounds of howling and suffering,
Those sounds are extremely painful, those who hear them give rise to aversion and fear.
The paths of hell, animals, and Yama,
These defiled and evil worlds always emit sounds of worry and suffering.
In some lands, there are always sounds of delight,
Agreeable to the mind and in accordance with the teachings, this is attained through pure karma.
In some lands, there are always the sounds of Indra,
Or the sounds of Brahma Heaven, and the sounds of all world guardians.
In some buddha-lands, wonderful sounds emerge from the clouds,
With the sounds of oceans of treasures, wish-fulfilling trees, and music filling everywhere.
Within the perfect radiance of the buddhas, the sounds of transformation are inexhaustible,
And the wonderful sounds of the bodhisattvas are heard throughout the worlds in the ten directions.
In the inconceivable lands, the sounds of universally turning the wheel of Dharma,
The sounds emanating from the ocean of vows, the sounds of practicing the subtle.
All the buddhas of the three times, giving rise to all worlds,
Their names are all complete, their sounds are inexhaustible.
In some lands, they hear the sounds of all buddhas' powers,
The stages of the earth and immeasurables, such Dharma is all expounded.
By the power of Samantabhadra's vows, subtle sounds are emitted in billions of lands,
Those sounds like thunder, abiding for eons, also inexhaustible.
The Buddha in the pure land manifests sounds of mastery,ğŸ”½In the ten directions and Dharma realms, all are heard.
